channel.title: Yesteryear - A project from scratch
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt][b]Intro[/b][/size] Yesteryear is a new server with revision #317 written completely from scratch. It is developed by me, and my goal is to make a basic server with login, player and NPC updating, walking, and maybe later on some basic content like trading and following. I will only work on this when I have time. And since I am kinda busy with school this will be about one hour a day. I am trying to keep you up to date by providing the latest version of the server.
[size=14pt][b]Networking[/b][/size] Yesteryear is written on the java.nio API. It makes use of the Reactor pattern. Which means, a single selection thread that distributes [i]nonblocking[/i] network events to worker threads in the event handler. Although I think it still has flaws in the design (for example synchronization), it works pretty well.
[size=14pt][b]Goals[/b][/size] As I said in the intro, I will not implement much of content itself but especially updating and basic stuff like trading and banking.
[u]Goals[/u]:
[ul][li][s]Implementation of the Reactor pattern[/s] DONE[/li] [li][s]Player login[/s] DONE[/li] [li][s]Packet handling (ingoing and outgoing)[/s]DONE[/li] [li]Player updating[/li] [li]NPC updating[/li] [li]Walking[/li] [li]Perhaps more...[/li][/ul]
[size=14pt][b]Pictures[/b][/size] There's not very much to show of yet. So here is a picture of a succeeded login [img]http://s9.postimage.org/yfv25pc9r/Screenshot_at_2012_12_09_20_50_34.png[/img]
Early stage of player updating! [img]http://s11.postimage.org/ylv7dgpsz/Screenshot_at_2012_12_12_17_17_52.png[/img]
[b][size=14pt]Current version[/size][/b] [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?aotuidr1h6ex8od]Click here to download the current version![/url] [/center]

item.title: Yesteryear - A project from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

[quote=“Fire capez, post:13, topic:472048”][quote author=Yesteryear link=topic=589740.msg4213445#msg4213445 date=1359905387]

Make a github so you don’t need to keep uploading the download link.

I stopped working on this project like 2 months ago I am making a JAGGRAB and Ondemand server atm, which I’m not especially making for this server although I can always combine them. I might continue this when I feel like it
[/quote]

ah, if you continue development I advise you dump the 317 protocol however. You might as well use a 377 client and cache given that our 317 servers load 377 cache anyway.[/quote]
Mine actually loads the 317 (maybe not the real 317, perhaps 319) cache, but it’s not too hard to switch since the cache format is the same

Read full topic

item.title: Yesteryear - A project from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote=“Yesteryear, post:12, topic:472048”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=589740.msg4213437#msg4213437 date=1359903806]
Make a github so you don’t need to keep uploading the download link.
[/quote]
I stopped working on this project like 2 months ago I am making a JAGGRAB and Ondemand server atm, which I’m not especially making for this server although I can always combine them. I might continue this when I feel like it :D[/quote]

ah, if you continue development I advise you dump the 317 protocol however. You might as well use a 377 client and cache given that our 317 servers load 377 cache anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Yesteryear - A project from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

Update:
Finally started updating. You can now actually see something :). I had some trouble with a bug in the ThreadPoolExecutor earlier. I know what the problem is, but have yet to fix it; I temporarily disabled the thread pool.

Read full topic

@Black_Not wrote:

good luck my friend, nice song.

Read full topic

item.title: Yesteryear - A project from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

[quote=“Black Not, post:6, topic:472048”]Could you go into more detail regarding

a single selection thread that distributes nonblocking network events to worker threads in the event handler

Does that mean 1 thread for the entire server? Isn’t that bad?[/quote]
There’s one thread that selects selection keys, these selection keys hold event data (OP_ACCEPT, OP_READ and OP_WRITE). These events are then distributed over a few worker threads. Worker threads are normal threads that are waiting to handle events (work). These worker threads actually read and write to the socket.

Read full topic

item.title: Yesteryear - A project from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Yesteryear Yesteryear
item.description:
@Yesteryear wrote:

Lin:

If you need help with player/NPC updating, just let me know. The system I have works very well and makes it capable of having 2000 players. Good luck!

Thanks for the offer, I might need it.

Latest update:
Completed packet encoding and decoding. Just the de/encoding itself.

Read full topic

@Yesteryear wrote:

[center][size=14pt]Intro[/size]
Yesteryear is a new server with revision #317 written completely from scratch. It is developed by me, and my goal is to make a basic server with login, player and NPC updating, walking, and maybe later on some basic content like trading and following.
I will only work on this when I have time. And since I am kinda busy with school this will be about one hour a day. I am trying to keep you up to date by providing the latest version of the server.

[size=14pt]Networking[/size]
Yesteryear is written on the java.nio API. It makes use of the Reactor pattern. Which means, a single selection thread that distributes nonblocking network events to worker threads in the event handler. Although I think it still has flaws in the design (for example synchronization), it works pretty well.

[size=14pt]Goals[/size]
As I said in the intro, I will not implement much of content itself but especially updating and basic stuff like trading and banking.

Goals:

[ul][li]Implementation of the Reactor pattern DONE[/li]
[li]Player login DONE[/li]
[li]Packet handling (ingoing and outgoing)DONE[/li]
[li]Player updating[/li]
[li]NPC updating[/li]

[li]Perhaps more…[/li][/ul]
